data.title: Hungarian male classical pianists
data.text:
Overview: Béla Viktor János Bartók (Hungarian: Bartók Béla, 25 March 1881 – 26 September 1945) was a Hungarian composer, pianist, and ethnomusicologist. He is considered one of the most important composers of the ...

Date of birth: 25 March 1881

Date of death: 26 September 1945

Age: 64 (age at death)

Nationality: Hungarian

Occupation: Composer

Gender: Male

Overview: György Kurtág (born 19 February 1926) is a Hungarian classical composer and pianist. He was an academic teacher of piano at the Franz Liszt Academy of Music from 1967, later also of chamber music, and ...

Date of birth: 19 February 1926

Age: 98

Nationality: Hungarian

Occupation: Composer

Gender: Male

Overview: Károly (Carl) Thern (13 August 1817 – 13 April 1886) was a Hungarian composer, pianist, conductor and arranger. He was of German descent, but was among the second generation of composers who developed ...

Date of birth: 13 August 1817

Date of death: 13 April 1886

Age: 68 (age at death)

Nationality: Hungarian

Occupation: Composer

Gender: Male

Overview: István Thomán (4 November 1862 – 22 September 1940) was a Hungarian piano virtuoso and music educator. He was a notable piano teacher, with students including Béla Bartók, Ernő Dohnányi and Georges ...

Date of birth: 4 November 1862

Date of death: 22 September 1940

Age: 77 (age at death)

Nationality: Hungarian

Occupation: Pianist

Gender: Male

Overview: Ödön (Edmund) Péter József de Mihalovich (September 13, 1842 in Fericsánci, Slavonia – April 22, 1929 in Budapest) was a Hungarian composer and music educator.

Date of birth: 13 September 1842

Date of death: 22 April 1929

Age: 86 (age at death)

Nationality: Hungarian

Occupation: Composer

Gender: Male

Overview: Gergely Bogányi is a Hungarian pianist. Coming from a musical family, Gergely Bogányi is one of the youngest pianists to have won the Kossuth Prize, becoming one of the leading pianists of his generation ...

Date of birth: 1974

Age: 50

Nationality: Hungarian

Occupation: Pianist

Gender: Male

Overview: Károly Aggházy, or Aggházy Károly in Hungarian order (30 October 1855 in Budapest – 8 October 1918 in Budapest) was a Hungarian piano virtuoso and composer.

Date of birth: 30 October 1855

Date of death: 8 October 1918

Age: 62 (age at death)

Nationality: Hungarian

Occupation: Composer

Gender: Male

Overview: Vincent Adler (3 April 1826, Győr – 4 January 1871, Geneva) was a Hungarian composer and pianist.

Date of birth: 3 April 1826

Date of death: 4 January 1871

Age: 44 (age at death)

Nationality: Hungarian

Occupation: Composer

Gender: Male

Overview: Louis Philip Kentner CBE (19 July 1905 – 23 September 1987) was a Hungarian, later British, pianist who excelled in the works of Chopin and Liszt, as well as the Hungarian repertoire.

Date of birth: 1905

Date of death: 1987

Age: 81 (age at death)

Nationality: Hungarian

Occupation: Composer

Gender: Male

Overview: Leó Weiner (16 April 1885 – 13 September 1960) was one of the leading Hungarian music educators of the first half of the twentieth century, and a composer.

Date of birth: 16 April 1885

Date of death: 13 September 1960

Age: 75 (age at death)

Nationality: Hungarian

Occupation: Composer

Gender: Male

Overview: Paul Arma (Hungarian: Arma Pál, aka Amrusz Pál; né Weisshaus Imre; 22 November 1905 in Budapest – 28 November 1987 in Paris) was a Hungarian-French pianist, composer, and ethnomusicologist.

Date of birth: 22 November 1905

Date of death: 28 November 1987

Age: 82 (age at death)

Nationality: Hungarian

Occupation: Composer

Gender: Male

Overview: Ernst von Dohnányi (Hungarian: Dohnányi Ernő, 27 July 1877 – 9 February 1960) was a Hungarian composer, pianist and conductor. He used a German form of his name on most of his published compositions.

Date of birth: 27 July 1877

Date of death: 9 February 1960

Age: 82 (age at death)

Nationality: Hungarian

Occupation: Educator

Gender: Male
